definition: (final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

pinyin: yi3 xian1 an4 bi3 luo4 wan2 tong2

sentences.english: Creak, Alis puts down a black.
It all depends on how you view life in general.
sentences.chinese: 全看你用什麼態度看待生活咯。

sentences.english: I hope he's right, 'cause if he's not, it'll cost him one of his three time-outs.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他是對的，不然三個暫停，就要被罰掉一個咯。

sentences.english: Oger:So you can save us money as well?
sentences.chinese: 因此，你們也能幫我們節省資金咯？

sentences.english: Does that mean there won't be profits to be made by cynically holding your nose and investing in the moment?
sentences.chinese: 就是說，不能強捏着鼻子投資獲利在當下咯？

sentences.english: Wang Fei: You mean, people like me, waiting for trains in my big anorak?
sentences.chinese: 你說的就是像我這種穿着皮猴等火車的人咯？

sentences.english: Maybe later we can all go blow our noses on my wedding dress!''
sentences.chinese: 回頭我們就可以用我的婚紗擤鼻涕了咯？

sentences.english: And sometimes I try to be MOM's good boy.
sentences.chinese: 所以咯，有時我也要儘儘孝嗒。

sentences.english: " I gas you "slightly tall, taller than me, they can challenge for the ball.
sentences.chinese: 我氣你“長高咯，比我高，就可以搶球。”

sentences.english: Well, at first, of course they help each other out.
sentences.chinese: 這個嘛，當然一開始會互相合作咯。

sentences.english: "The house is being raffled off, " Hart said.
sentences.chinese: “房子要被抽籤出售咯”海特說道。

sentences.english: The cough means the sound generated from the reverse flow of gas from lung with the phlegm.
sentences.chinese: 咳嗽是指肺氣上逆作聲，咯吐痰液而言。
打彈子游戲就此開始咯。

sentences.english: It was time to go out and scare a few people and raid their houses.
sentences.chinese: 看來該是時候出去嚇嚇人，搜刮搜刮他們的房子咯。

sentences.english: Of course I did, I went to Anji.
sentences.chinese: 那當然咯，我去了安吉玩。

sentences.english: Bones: And I told you who it was so we’re even .
sentences.chinese: 結果還是我告訴你誰幹的，我們倆扯平咯。

definition: (onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
